item.description:
Changes to Our Pilot Webinar Effort for Wednesday’s Boston IBD Main Meeting


  • RSVP with the link provided on this page. You do not need to send us email.
  • Also, join our Google Group that is solely for coordinating our video efforts. It is here. This will take the place of a video email distribution list.



Thanks to Jeff’s effort our Wednesday meeting will be available as a webinar. This is a test, but you will be able to view the full meeting remotely. We need people to try it out and give us feedback on making it better. Also, we need people to help make it happen.

These are the revised instructions for Wednesday, January 28, to participate:
  • Join the Google Group BostonInvestorsVideo and post a response to the posting about attending the January 28, 2009 Webinar of the Main Meeting. This is so that we know how many people will be participating virtually.
  • At 7:00 PM on Wednesday 1/28 (tomorrow), open a browser and go to http://orrik.glance.n...
  • Type in the access code: 9999
  • Call the conference line at 1-605-475-4323 and punch in access code 556636 when prompted. Long distance charges apply to this call.
  • Enjoy. Learn. Be forgiving for this pilot effort’s failings.
  • Post feedback on our Google Group BostonInvestorsVideo.




To help make this happen:
  • We MUST have a telephone at the meeting with unlimited minutes for long-distance to provide the audio to the webinar service. Neither my phone nor Jeff’s phone has this feature.
  • We are spending some money to make this happen so if you would send money to me at Doug Roberts, 43A Riverside Farm Drive, Lee, NH 03861. We anticipate some expenses for software, hardware, webinar service and phone service.
  • If you are an accountant, or just a reliable bill payer, and would track and disburse these small funds, please email me to volunteer.
  • If you would help improve the service, join our video Google Group called BostonInvestorsVideo. We need help.




Free would be nice
We are not trying to become a profit making organization. We just want to offer live meetings at the very lowest possible cost. Free would be nice.

Onward!

Doug & Jeff
item.name: Boston IBD Main Meeting Webinar Pilot
